Interface ec.ez.scope.Scope

public interface Scope
A potentially mutable mapping from names (strings) to values (arbitrary objects, including null). Scopes inherit from each other in a tree like fashion, so they can be used to model nesting lexical environments. The associations in the most leafward part of a Scope are called "locals".

The type Scope only provides query operations but a subtype, ScopeEditor, provides edit operations as well. A given Scope reference may or may not actually be a ScopeEditor, depending on whether it is supposed to grant edit authority.

bindings()
Returns a string showing the bindings in this scope in a pleasant human readable format
extend(String[], Object[])
Like sprout, but also defines in the result each pair of a name and a value.
get(String)
What value is associated with 'name'? Uses the first association up the inheritance chain.
get(String, Object)
What value is associated with 'name'? Uses the first association up the inheritance chain.
mapping()
A snapshot of the name-to-value mapping represented by this Scope.
optDefiningTable(String)
This Scope potentially inherits from other Scopes.
readOnly()
Returns the Scope stone-cast to give only a read-only view.
sprout()
Makes and returns a new ScopeEditor that inherits from this Scope.
sprout(boolean)
Version of sprout that flags this level of the Scope as permitting redefinition if the redefOK flag is set.

optDefiningTable 
 public abstract Scope optDefiningTable(String name) throws AlreadyDefinedException
This Scope potentially inherits from other Scopes. Of all these Scope, which one defines 'name'? A child has priority over its parents, but a collision between parents throws an AlreadyDefinedException. If none define 'name', return null. XXX Security bug: A read-only Scope will reveal read-write parents.

get 
 public abstract Object get(String name) throws UndefinedVariableException, AlreadyDefinedException
What value is associated with 'name'? Uses the first association up the inheritance chain.

get 
 public abstract Object get(String name,
                            Object instead) throws AlreadyDefinedException
What value is associated with 'name'? Uses the first association up the inheritance chain.

readOnly 
 public abstract Scope readOnly()
Returns the Scope stone-cast to give only a read-only view. If this Scope is already read-only, just return it.

sprout 
 public abstract ScopeEditor sprout()
Makes and returns a new ScopeEditor that inherits from this Scope. This new Scope starts with an empty set of locals.

sprout 
 public abstract ScopeEditor sprout(boolean redefOK)
Version of sprout that flags this level of the Scope as permitting redefinition if the redefOK flag is set.

extend 
 public abstract ScopeEditor extend(String names[],
                                    Object values[]) throws ArityMismatchException, AlreadyDefinedException
Like sprout, but also defines in the result each pair of a name and a value. The names and values arrays must have the same arity.

mapping 
 public abstract Mapping mapping()
A snapshot of the name-to-value mapping represented by this Scope. This is composed through the inheritance chain, with a child's association occluding a parent's association for the same name.

bindings 
 public abstract String bindings()
Returns a string showing the bindings in this scope in a pleasant human readable format
